definitions.definition: a group of people who work on and operate a ship, boat, aircraft, spacecraft, or train.
a group of people working on a ship, aircraft, etc., other than the officers.
examples: the ship's captain and crew may be brought to trial

definitions.definition: the sport of rowing a racing shell.
a group of people who work closely together.
synonyms: gang "a crew of cameramen and sound engineers"

definitions.definition: a group of people associated in some way.
examples: a crew of assorted computer geeks

definitions.definition: a group of rappers, breakdancers, or graffiti artists performing or operating together.
provide (a craft or vehicle) with a group of people to operate it.
examples: normally the boat is crewed by 5 people

definitions.definition: act as a member of a crew, subordinate to a captain.
examples: I've never crewed for a world-famous yachtsman before
